description: Meyers fact-checked Trump’ s claim to have christened the former defense secretary“ Mad Dog”:“ We know you didn’ t come up with it because it’ s a cool nickname.”
text:
Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous night's highlights
that lets you sleep -- and lets us get paid to watch comedy. We're all stuck
at home at the moment, so here are the50 best movies on Netflix right nowWho
Let 'Mad Dog' Out?On Wednesday, the former defense secretaryJim Mattis
criticized President Trump's handling of the nationwide protests over police
violence,"Replied Trump, 'I know you are, but what am I?'" Seth Meyers said on
Thursday's "Late Night."Mattis resigned in 2018, thoughTrump claimed this week
to have fired him"OK, first of all, he resigned, you didn't fire him. Second,
you didn't come up with the name 'Mad Dog' -- he's had it since at least 2004
and we know you didn't come up with it because it's a cool nickname and your
nicknames suck. Sorry. Sorry, dude. If you come up with a nickname for him, it
would have been something like 'Lame James' or 'Jumpin' Jim.'"-- SETH
MEYERS"What a strange thing to lie about. It's so easily disproved. Remember
the movie 'Romy and Michele's High School Reunion' where they lie and say they
invented Post-it notes? It's like that, but from the president."-- JIMMY
KIMMEL"Mattis added that 'We must not be distracted by a small number of
lawbreakers. The protests are defined by tens of thousands of people of
conscience who are insisting that we live up to our values -- our values as
people and our values as a nation.' That is a stirring message of compassion,
unity, and reason from -- 'Mad Dog'? I hereby rename you 'Principled
Pooch.'"-- STEPHEN COLBERT"In a statement, General Mattis said, 'Donald Trump
is the first president in my lifetime who does not try to unite the American
people, does not even pretend to try. Instead, he tries to divide us.' Trump
saw that and was like, 'Why don't you be a man and tweet that to my face?'"--
JIMMY FALLONThe Punchiest Punchlines (Fence Me In Edition)"Trump denied he's
trying to divide us. Then he added more fencing between him and the
protesters.""Yep, Trump is trying to protect the White House. He even ran
around putting broken Christmas ornaments under windows and tying rope to
paint cans to swing over the staircase.""Authorities there are busy erecting
another fence that will go around the existing White House fence, which will
make two fences, which I think was a Spin Doctors song. So it looks like Trump
is finally getting his wall built after all. How long before we find out Don
Jr. invested in a fence company?""I always said, 'I wish the White House
looked like a Little League backstop.'""So far, Trump has turned off the White
House lights, hid in a bunker and is now building an ugly chain link fence.
He's like every crazy neighbor rolled into one."The Bits Worth WatchingThe
"Late Show" writer Olivia Harewood helped James Corden locate his white
privilege and told him to harness his powers for good.Also, Check This
OutImageMichaela Coel is the creator and star of "I May Destroy You,"
premiering Sunday on HBO.Credit...Michaela Coel, star of "Chewing Gum," plays
a young woman coming to terms with trauma in hernew coming-of-age HBO series,
"I May Destroy You."

title: Seth Meyers Mocks Trump’s ‘Mad’ Mattis Tweets [The New York Times]
html: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous night’s highlights that lets you sleep — and lets us get paid to watch comedy. We’re all stuck at home at the moment, so here are the50 best movies on Netflix right nowWho Let ‘Mad Dog’ Out?On Wednesday, the former defense secretaryJim Mattis criticized President Trump’s handling of the nationwide protests over police violence,“Replied Trump, ‘I know you are, but what am I?’” Seth Meyers said on Thursday’s “Late Night.”Mattis resigned in 2018, thoughTrump claimed this week to have fired him“OK, first of all, he resigned, you didn’t fire him. Second, you didn’t come up with the name ‘Mad Dog’ — he’s had it since at least 2004 and we know you didn’t come up with it because it’s a cool nickname and your nicknames suck. Sorry. Sorry, dude. If you come up with a nickname for him, it would have been something like ‘Lame James’ or ‘Jumpin’ Jim.’”— SETH MEYERS“What a strange thing to lie about. It’s so easily disproved. Remember the movie ‘Romy and Michele’s High School Reunion’ where they lie and say they invented Post-it notes? It’s like that, but from the president.”— JIMMY KIMMEL“Mattis added that ‘We must not be distracted by a small number of lawbreakers. The protests are defined by tens of thousands of people of conscience who are insisting that we live up to our values — our values as people and our values as a nation.’ That is a stirring message of compassion, unity, and reason from — ‘Mad Dog’? I hereby rename you ‘Principled Pooch.’”— STEPHEN COLBERT“In a statement, General Mattis said, ‘Donald Trump is the first president in my lifetime who does not try to unite the American people, does not even pretend to try. Instead, he tries to divide us.’ Trump saw that and was like, ‘Why don’t you be a man and tweet that to my face?’”— JIMMY FALLONThe Punchiest Punchlines (Fence Me In Edition)“Trump denied he’s trying to divide us. Then he added more fencing between him and the protesters.”“Yep, Trump is trying to protect the White House. He even ran around putting broken Christmas ornaments under windows and tying rope to paint cans to swing over the staircase.”“Authorities there are busy erecting another fence that will go around the existing White House fence, which will make two fences, which I think was a Spin Doctors song. So it looks like Trump is finally getting his wall built after all. How long before we find out Don Jr. invested in a fence company?"“I always said, ‘I wish the White House looked like a Little League backstop.’”“So far, Trump has turned off the White House lights, hid in a bunker and is now building an ugly chain link fence. He’s like every crazy neighbor rolled into one.”The Bits Worth WatchingThe “Late Show” writer Olivia Harewood helped James Corden locate his white privilege and told him to harness his powers for good.Also, Check This OutImageMichaela Coel is the creator and star of “I May Destroy You,” premiering Sunday on HBO.Credit...Michaela Coel, star of “Chewing Gum,” plays a young woman coming to terms with trauma in hernew coming-of-age HBO series, “I May Destroy You.”
